metadata.synopsis:
The players approach the drow commander at the goblin camp, escorted by a goblin who they rescued from a nearby druid grove. The drow is seeking that grove and upon learning its location from the goblin will prepare to raid it, demanding that the player help.

If the goblin recognises that the player is a True Soul - a figure of authority - her life will be spared. If she does not recognise this, the drow will execute her unless the player intervenes on her behalf.

41.speaker: Sazza
41.text: Mistress! It's me, yer loyal servant, Sazza. I'm back - an' I brought a friend.

3.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
3.text: A duergar? Tell me, Sazza, did your misadventures take you to the Underdark?

66.speaker: Sazza
66.text: They woz in some rickety druid grove! Mostly full of tieflin's, but them intruders you're after were hidin' out there!

20.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
20.text: I presume you dealt with my prey, and massacred the rest?

11.speaker: Sazza
11.text: Ah... well, the thing about that is... they sorta massacred us.

74.speaker: Sazza
74.text: This mug helped me escape though. I say we stick a few holes in them... show how grateful we are.

15.speaker: Narrator
15.text: *You feel a cold hand caress your mind as the drow appraises you.*
15.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera cuts from player to drow as mindmeld occures

58.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
58.text: Oh dear. Your prisoner is one of the Absolute's favourites, Sazza. A True Soul.

5.speaker: Sazza
5.text: Nah. Can't be... they woz in the grove, hangin' around with the tieflin's.

57.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
57.text: Undercover, no doubt. Carrying out the Absolute's will. Oh, Sazza - you have made a grave error.

48.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
48.text: And it will be your last. My spiders are hungry, little one...

62.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
62.text: ...but before they feast, tell me where that grove is, and I may yet spare your life.

54.speaker: Sazza
54.text: It's past the bridge, to the east! Big ol' gate, covered in ivy! Don't hurt me, mistress. Please!

68.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
68.text: I will not hurt you. My spiders will have that pleasure.

38.speaker: Sazza
38.text: No! I mucked up, I'm sorry! But I didn't know who they woz... they didn't tell me nothin'!

13.speaker: Player
13.text: You only have to look at me to know I'm your superior, wretch.

76.speaker: Sazza
76.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The captured goblin is dragged away by goblin guards. [Hide Sazza after walk off]

30.speaker: Sazza
30.text: You coulda told me who you woz!

17.speaker: Player
17.text: She's telling the truth. She didn't know.

14.speaker: Sazza
14.text: I told ya! I was tryin' to follow orders best I could!

22.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
22.text: Silence, wretch. And remember - you owe your miserable life to this one.

69.speaker: Sazza
69.text: I won't cause any more trouble - I swears it.
69.context: CinematicNodeContext: [reuse] The captured goblin scuttles away. [Hide Sazza after walk off]

21.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
21.text: Through sheer luck, that pathetic worm has brought me the information I need.

46.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
46.text: And it seems that the inhabitants of the grove trust you - we can use that against them.

63.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
63.text: You have a part to play in this slaughter.

10.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
10.text: Return to the grove. When my raiding party approaches, throw open the gate and signal me.

64.speaker: Narrator
64.text: *The fate of the grove's inhabitants hangs in the balance.*

56.speaker: Narrator
56.text: *Killing the drow here would spare them, but it might be better to face her warband at the grove itself, on familiar ground.*

40.speaker: Narrator
40.text: *On the other hand, participating in the slaughter as she asks may be the perfect way to earn her trust, and access to the cult's inner circle.*

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Many of the inhabitants of the grove are already dead.

75.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
75.text: You started the slaughter without me? How selfish.

19.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
19.text: But we can still fight side by side. Together, we will destroy any who have not died or fled.

8.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
8.text: I will gather my warband - we will reach the grove by next light.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: There's a problem - the grove is sealed by a druid ritual.

70.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
70.text: Their god is weak. Roots and branches will not save them from the Absolute's fury.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: I want no part of this.

49.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
49.text: I do not intend to lead a suicidal charge. The goblins are expendable; I am not.

34.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
34.text: The Absolute brought you here for a reason - to throw open those gates and crush our enemies.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: All right. Expect me at the grove.

1.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
1.text: Good. Marshalling the goblins is no simple matter, but my warband will be ready to attack by next light.

43.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
43.text: Once we are in position, we will wait for your signal, and then we will break them all.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: I have another matter to take care of first.

26.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
26.text: Take care of it quickly. You are needed here, and my patience wears thin.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: And I'm happy to do it - for a price.

28.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
28.text: You are honoured to serve a cause - a god. What greater reward could there be?

52.speaker: Player
52.text: I won't be much use to the cause if I'm destitute.

18.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
18.text: I will gather my warband, and reach the grove by next light.

45.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
45.text: You must make your way inside. Once I am in position, on your signal, we break them.

55.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
55.text: Kill our enemies, and take what you need.

31.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
31.text: We are servants of the one true god, not mercenaries.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: You're right. Serving the Absolute is its own reward.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: The Absolute has nothing to do with it. I'm here to kill you.

47.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
47.text: You would dare...? Guards - to me!

27.speaker: Player
27.text: You misunderstand. I'm here to slaughter you.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: I explained everything to her. She's just too stupid to understand.

36.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
36.text: A liar as well as a fool? I hope you're at least digestible.

67.speaker: Sazza
67.text: It ain't true! Them's the bloody liars!

59.speaker: Sazza
59.text: I got myself nabbed though; ended up all snug in a cage instead of smashed. I'm wily like that.

39.speaker: Sazza
39.text: And then the Absolute answered my prayers - sent a True Soul to save me!

4.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
4.text: A drow? Tell me, Sazza, did your misadventures take you to the Underdark?

61.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
61.text: How thoughtful. And where did you find this friend?
